conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to use the principles of statics and mechanics.
The light rope is connected to block A through two pulleys, and the angle of the light rope on both sides of the pulley is 90°. The inclination of the smooth slope is 30°.
The force of gravity acting on block A is \(mg\).
The force of friction acting on the light rope is \(f\).
The force of friction acting on the pulleys is \(f\).
The net force acting on block A must be zero.
The sum of the forces in the vertical direction for block A must be zero.
The vertical force due to gravity on block A is \(mg\), and the vertical force due to friction is \(f\).
The force of gravity acting on block B is \(mg\).
The force of friction acting on the pulleys is \(f\).
The net force acting on block B must be zero.
The sum of the forces in the vertical direction for block B must be zero.
The vertical force due to gravity on block B is \(mg\), and the vertical force due to friction is \(f\).
The mass of block B is \(m\).
